node.title: 'The placenta is a fascinating organ': Jane Dahlstrom researches placentas to give families answers following childbirth
node.description: A placenta brought two clinician-researches together at Canberra Hospital 15 years ago. Now the pair are encouraging fellow doctors and nurses to take up research opportunities in the field. Warning: This story contains medical images.
node.content:
["When it comes to childbirth, it is not the baby \u2014 but what comes after \u2014 that Professor Jane Dahlstrom is most interested in.", "That is lucky because much of Professor Dahlstrom's career has revolved around the workings of the placenta \u2014 a baby's source of nutrients whilst inside the womb.", "Warning: This story contains medical images.", "As a clinician-researcher at Canberra Hospital,\u00a0Professor Dahlstrom spends many hours each week studying the organ soon after it has been delivered.", "The size, shape and texture of a placenta can help to explain why a newborn may be underweight or overweight.", "", "
Jane Dahlstrom spends hours researching placentas to give families answers following childbirth.\u00a0(ABC News: Rosie King)
", "\"My main aim is to try to give answers to families and to clinicians as to the reason why there might be an adverse outcome,\" she said.", "\"Once I think I know why, the next question both the doctor and the family has is, can it happen again and can they do anything differently next time to prevent it from happening?", "Professor Dahlstrom's passion for improving outcomes for pregnant women and their babies has brought an added bonus \u2014 it led her to her now-husband, endocrinologist Professor Chris Nolan.", "\"Everybody knows I call him the man of my dreams and he is,\" Professor Dahlstrom said.", "\"He's a deep thinker with great ideas and I'm probably more the realist when it comes to our partnership but I think that's what makes it successful.\"", "", "
The size, shape and texture of a placenta can help to explain why a newborn may be underweight or overweight.(ABC News: Rosie King)
", "Professor Nolan, also a clinician-researcher, has a special interest in diabetes in pregnancy.", "It was a placenta that first brought the pair together at Canberra Hospital 15 years ago.", "Now, research is at the core of what they do.", "\"When it comes to research, Jane is very honest, she will tell you exactly how it is,\" Professor Nolan said.", "\"If you're onto something that's useful and valuable, she'll encourage us to look more at that but if she thinks we're on a dud path, she'll be quick to question whether it's worthwhile.", "", "
Chris Nolan says he enjoys \"creating new knowledge\" that\u00a0leads to medical advancements.\u00a0(ABC News: Rosie King)
", "
Doctors, nurses encouraged to take on research
", "Canberra Health Services (CHS) wants more of its staff to follow in the footsteps of Professor Dahlstrom and Professor Nolan.", "The organisation has released a new strategy that outlines its plan to become a key leader in health and medical research by creating partnerships with universities in Canberra and transforming the workplace culture.", "\"There have been pockets of research excellence and there is excellent research happening but it hasn't really promulgated beyond those pockets,\" Professor Imogen Mitchell, CHS executive director of research, said.", "Staff who secure positions as clinical researchers will be given dedicated time, access to mentors and funding to complete their projects.", "\"I think there are a lot of people who are interested but they just don't know how to start,\" Professor Mitchell said.", "", "
Professor Dahlstrom wants to inspire more Canberra Health Services staff to take on research projects.(ABC News: Rosie King)
", "The ultimate goal is to improve patient care but also to attract top-tier specialists to the workforce in Canberra.", "\"There's a wealth of talent worldwide and if we're going to stake our claim in that, we have to be a research-forward organisation,\" CHS chief executive Dave Peffer said.", "\"We have to offer people the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects that really drive us forward as an institution to provide that top-level care.\"", "Professor Nolan said the biggest challenge of being a doctor and a researcher was finding enough hours in the day.", "He and Professor Dahlstrom are often found in the lab in the evenings and on weekends but he said the rewards made it worthwhile.", "\"As a clinician, you've only got the knowledge and the resources that are present at that time and you base your best clinical practice on that evidence but there are always gaps in evidence,\" he said.", "\"And it's from the research that you fill in those gaps and you actually create new knowledge."]
